title: FT/FS: SGC 40 Happy Smith Black Lenox. SOLD.
author: Thromdog

posts.post_title: FT/FS: SGC 40 Happy Smith Black Lenox. SOLD.
posts.post_content:
Card has been sold. Thanks to everyone for inquiring......

[IMG]https://farm1.staticflickr.com/957/41712462972_4598a18288_b.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]https://farm1.staticflickr.com/965/41712464252_6b5431c9db_o.jpg[/IMG]

My two cents? Keep the Lenox. It’s a nice, clean example, and when the Green Cobb craze starts fading, everyone will turn attention back to rare backs. I’ve seen this trend happen time after time over the last 25 years. Not saying Green Cobb is gonna drop drastically, but the craze will fade a bit. Your Lenox is great.

[quote name="MVSNYC" post=1771848]My two cents? Keep the Lenox. It’s a nice, clean example, and when the Green Cobb craze starts fading, everyone will turn attention back to rare backs. I’ve seen this trend happen time after time over the last 25 years. Not saying Green Cobb is gonna drop drastically, but the craze will fade a bit. Your Lenox is great.[/QUOTE]

+1

[quote name="MVSNYC" post=1771848]My two cents? Keep the Lenox. It’s a nice, clean example, and when the Green Cobb craze starts fading, everyone will turn attention back to rare backs. I’ve seen this trend happen time after time over the last 25 years. Not saying Green Cobb is gonna drop drastically, but the craze will fade a bit. Your Lenox is great.[/QUOTE]

A voice of reason !!

[quote name="MVSNYC" post=1771848]My two cents? Keep the Lenox. It’s a nice, clean example, and when the Green Cobb craze starts fading, everyone will turn attention back to rare backs. I’ve seen this trend happen time after time over the last 25 years. Not saying Green Cobb is gonna drop drastically, but the craze will fade a bit. Your Lenox is great.[/QUOTE]

I've also seen a large trend in backs dropping with David Hall now out of the picture....Just saying.....
I haven’t notice that. There’s many other whales out there collecting rare backs, and more than a few people working on master sets.

[quote name="MVSNYC" post=1772070]I haven’t notice that. There’s many other whales out there collecting rare backs, and more than a few people working on master sets.[/QUOTE]

No Michael, there's not. There has been two huge Master collectors in the past several years who are close on completion, one has been Hall who is out of the picture, and has been for a few years, this has accounted for stupid prices of backs. The other I will not name, but he is also much more reserved in crazy pricing..
...It sounds like you are trying to set the table for your backs??? Could it be?
I collect the backs , but not going for the master set

[quote name="MVSNYC" post=1772070]I haven’t notice that. There’s many other whales out there collecting rare backs, and more than a few people working on master sets.[/QUOTE]

Man, I got to tell you....You are a great salesman.....Many whales? You didn't by chance be the one that bought Jeff's Lenox?

Sold to a friend outside of N54 for a fair price.

Now gotta see if this one has any interest or else it’s staying put in the PC.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/picture.php?albumid=999&pictureid=24367[/IMG]

Congrats Jeff.

Kevin- I did not buy Jeff’s card. I was merely stating my opinion. There’s no agenda here on my part, my intention was to give Jeff my opinion about holding the Lenox versus going for a green Cobb.
